meanings.definition: An abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.
meanings.sent1: Scoliosis can cause back pain and discomfort.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can diagnose scoliosis through a physical examination.
meanings.sent3: The scoliosis in the spine made the skeleton look like a question mark.
meanings.sent4: Her scoliosis was a winding road along her backbone.
meanings.sent5: The scoliosis twisted her spine like a ribbon, making it hard to stand straight.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the spine curves sideways in an S or C shape.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended exercises to help manage her scoliosis.
meanings.sent2: Scoliosis can sometimes be treated with a back brace.
meanings.sent3: The scoliosis in his spine made him lean to one side like the Tower of Pisa.
meanings.sent4: Her scoliosis was like a gentle wave flowing along her back.
meanings.sent5: The scoliosis in her spine created a graceful curve, like a dancer in motion.
